units.title: Construct kNN graph and cluster
units.text: adata column organoid_age_days, constructed a kNN graph (k = 30) in the RSS space and clustered the which described the number of days the organoid had been in culture dataset using the Leiden algorithm83 (resolution 80).
units.rationale: Describes building a neighbor graph and clustering the data.

units.title: Remove non‑applicable subsets
units.text:
We next removed any non-applicable subsets of the published data- sets:
For further quality control, cells with fewer than 300 detected genes

units.title: Download primary atlas data
units.text: The cell ranger-processed scRNA-seq data for the primary atlas27 were obtained from the link provided on its GitHub page (https://storage.googleapis.com/linnarsson-lab-human/human_dev_GRCh38-3.0.0.h5ad).
units.rationale: Provides the source of reference data used later.

units.title: Apply label‑transfer to non‑telencephalic cells
units.text: The label-transfer procedure was only applied to the non-telencephalic NPCs and neurons in HNOCA.
units.rationale: Limits label transfer to specific cell populations.

units.title: Hierarchical label transfer
units.text: Next, a hierarchical label transfer, which takes into account the 2,000 structure hierarchy, was applied.

units.title: Train scArches model
units.text:
We used scArches through scPoli and trained the model for 500 epochs without unlabelled prototype training.
We computed the wkNN graph using the compute_wknn method of the mapper instance with k = 100.

units.title: Transfer final cell type labels
units.text:
We transferred the final level_2 cell type labels from HNOCA to the community datasets.
First, we projected the HNOCA to a single-cell atlas for cell type annotation and differential expression (DE) analysis.
units.rationale: Applies the learned annotations to external datasets.
